item.title: If you could go anywhere in the world, where would you go? Fulbright Information session
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Students interested in doing graduate level research, seeking a degree, or teaching English for a year abroad, should attend this information session on the Fulbright U.S. Student program. Students that will have a bachelors degree by fall 2027 and are U.S. citizens are encouraged to attend. Many Master’s and PhD students conduct research abroad for their U.S. degree program. Register: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe/form/SV_6L3FFwv0qCROrvE For…

item.title: Become an I-PERSIST Mentor for Fall 2026 – apply by January 30!
item.description: Are you interested in becoming a mentor to new students in Calculus, Physics, or Chemistry? Apply to become an I-PERSIST mentor today! Share your subject knowledge, gain leadership skills, connect with faculty, and help new students adjust to RPI! Our application for Fall 2026 closes on January 30, so don’t wait. Click to view the application!

item.title: Webinar on Friday January 30: RPI Digital Asset Management (DAM) System
item.description: Join Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, on Friday January 30 from 11am to 12pm, for a live webinar introducing Rensselaer’s Digital Asset Management System. Discover how to access campus‑wide photography, multimedia files, and institutional assets—all in one place. Register now: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700

item.title: Parking enforcement begins January 26, 2026
item.description: A variety of parking permit options are available to meet the needs of students, faculty, and staff. Please review the parking policies and make sure your vehicle information is up to date. If you have questions or need help getting a permit, contact Parking at parking@rpi.edu or 518-276-8528.

item.title: RPI Libraries: Guided Group Tours
item.description: Guided library tours are now available for students, faculty, staff, and campus groups at both the Folsom Library and the Architecture Library. These brief, bookable tours introduce library spaces, services, and resources, and can be customized to fit your group’s needs or research interests…

item.title: Campus Community Invited to ISC2 Cybersecurity Chapter Meetup | Jan 27
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 27, 2026 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - All are welcome to join an upcoming ISC2 Capital District NY chapter meeting for a cybersecurity briefing from the FBI, including active and emerging threats, trends in ransomware, and latest in data breaches. Open to the RPI community!

item.title: Watch PBS’s NOVA documentary featuring RPI professor Karyn Rogers and grad student Meri Herrero
item.description: The astrobiology research of Karyn Rogers, Ph.D., director of the Rensselaer Astrobiology Research and Education Center, and RPI graduate student Meri Herrero are featured in PBS’s 1st NOVA documentary of the season, “Asteroids: Spark of Life?” If you missed it on PBS, watch online at https://to.pbs.org/3LJjnhM.
item.author: Community

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: Supervisory Essentials
item.description: In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience a “day in the life” of a Supervisor. In addition, the importance of managing employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.
